website_summaries.verdict: A decent price for a sturdy, adjustable wheel chock, but you may want to consider other options if your bike has narrow tires.
pros: Made from durable steel, with a textured powder coating
Also available in a deluxe version, which comes with tie-downs
cons: The chock itself is a little wide
narrow tires may float around in it too much

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but wide wheel chock
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of those for a 5x8 enclosed trailer to hold an R6 Yamaha and a ZX7R Kawasaki. It was really easy to mount and they feel very sturdy. Once bolted to the wooden floor, they would not bulged at all. When the front wheels are inside, they feel securely lock to not roll back and forth. But it feels like the motorcycle could easily fell of on one side or the other. With tie downs and canyon dancer, this won't happen during transport. But I would not recommend this product to anyone who just want to roll their bike in their garage. Good product if you want to transport your motorcycle with tie-downs.
customer_reviews.author: Elsa T.

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this  motorcycle wheelchoc.
customer_reviews.text: I actually modified it by adding a longer piece of angle iron. that way it fit on the existing floor anchors without having to drill into the RV floor. and it's easily removable. It's work really well carrying my midsize Kawasaki weighing in about 500 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: billy boone

customer_reviews.title: Well I sure was happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Well I sure was happy with my purchase , the assembly was easy, the product itself rock solid tough and everything I hoped it would be. I mounted it and pulled my Harley Davidson in and locked her in. It held nicely and enough space so that I can (if I so choose) to leave on kickstand when strapping it down . Not a option in many wheel chocks. I bought three of these and should I sell my trailer will be buying these again. By far the best ones that I have seen even at all the bike rally events. Dave Steffen Traditions Motorcycle Club
customer_reviews.author: Dad who reviews

customer_reviews.title: More than "SOME ASSEMBLY REQUIRED" needed, to make chock work great!
customer_reviews.text: This chock seems well designed and built, other than the cheap hollow studs, welded into the cross angle iron, used to secure to main channel of chock. I twisted one of them off, during assembly, and found it hollow. I drilled and punched remaining portion out, and repaired with actual grade 8 bolts (I replaced the other stud, too). Once I made the repair, the chock works great. I contacted Amazon to let them know, since they are marketing the product, and asked them to pass the complaint on to the Mfr of the product. Amazon treated me well.
customer_reviews.author: Eyeryde

customer_reviews.title: VERY HIGH QUALITY. WORKS GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this wheel chalk on my utility trailer for hauling big road bikes and it works really great. I am very happy with it. It is constructed of very heavy steel and is easy to install. I have had no issues whatsoever hauling big motorcycles with this chalk. I'm very happy that I chose this. I have hauled a Goldwing GL1500, a Victory Touring Classic, and a couple of big Harleys with no issues. I wasn't sure if the front fender would clear on the Goldwing but is does. Very satisfied with this purchase. Super high quality and flawless operation. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Audioforge

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my bike
customer_reviews.text: The stand is well made and very sturdy, but would be best used when the motorcycle is also tied down - like in a pickup or on a trailer. The stand did not hold my motorcycle upright as perhaps the standard tires on my Triumph T100 were too narrow? In any event, use if you will also be tying down your bike. I would not recommend using it in a garage for storage.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: The product is made of good quality. Yet
customer_reviews.text: The product is made of good quality. Yet...... I loaded my Goldwing onto the chock with no problem. However, I'm so short and the Goldwing is so high that I can't push the front wheel out of the Chock without assistance. I need longer legs. My short term solution was to take the rear pivot off of the chock and just secure the tire to the front bar with a tie-down.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Much cheaper than buying an actual motorcycle trailer!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a motorcycle trailer for my 2015 Yamaha R6, but HATE the price tag that comes with it. We opted to get this stand and mounted it to a trailer instead. WAY more affordable. We drove from MO to NM with this mount and it held up beautifully then entire time! I would definitely recommend. It even holds our dirt bikes well which I was concerned about since they have slimmer tires. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazonaholic

customer_reviews.title: Well Built.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this tool as of yet however it is well built. Looks like all the issues some others have had with the bolts were worked out. Never had to readjust the bike on a 3K trip from Washington to the South-Central Texas. I did have straps on the bike but bike never moved. Unloading would have been difficult however I ran a ratchet strap under the tire to hold the bracket in place while I pulled on the bike with a winch to control removal of my bike. A VTX 1800 R with lots of extras, Est. weight at 900 lbs plus some.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Very close to perfect
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product. My ONLY complaint is the hardware it came with rusted within the first 6 months. I replaced them with stainless hardware for a few $ and it's perfect now. Holds my 2017 Road King up all by itself with ease. Just make sure you have the flipper put in the right spot before you load or it will chew up the bottom of your fender. I learned the hard way. That was my fault though! I will be buying a second one for my trailer very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Allows secure upright maintenance.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as advertised. My bike room space is limited. I use this to hold my FXDF upright for maintenance and modifications. Two anchors flush mounted in floor allow me to remove when not needed in order to free up space. It stores easily under engine bench. For a little extra support (confidence) I use small ratchet straps to secure bike to engine table. (Really heavy work bench) This allows the bike to be very stable during maintenance, level for fluid levels. Withstands curious grandson that wants to learn and climb. I plan on using it on trailer as well. Removable anchor bolts you have a can't lose tool.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money
customer_reviews.text: Pro's; 1. Nice and heavy, easily holding a thousand pound motorcycle. 2. Easy to assemble, all bolts and lock nuts are the same size. 3. Easy to mount but does not come with mounting bolts which is understandable as each trailer is different. 4. Great value for the money. Con's; 1. Rear toggle/rocker portion does not have bearings or additional washers to act as such so is very stiff if tightened as the other bolts. If left loose it may cause the bolts to wallow out the hole in a few years.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: 2020 Kawasaki Z900
customer_reviews.text: This fits my 2020 Kawasaki Z900 but only on the smallest setting it holds it with no worry that it will fall over but testing how far it can lean the bike could definitely lean very uncomfortably far and if not mounted down the bike could fall over but this requires a lot of pushing. Over all first impression are good, easy to put together. No Mounting hardware is included. Side note the nuts are 17mm and the bolts are 5/8th
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDOG

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, look good, easy install, fast delivery.
customer_reviews.text: I put two of these on my m/c trailer. They are strong, easy to install and are easy to use. I have a Super Glide Sport which weighs 650lbs and they hold the bike in place easily, without the kickstand while I strap it down. I highly recommend them. I live in East Tennessee and will trailer my bike and my friends bike out to California this coming summer. I am sure these will work without problem. They are reasonably priced and the delivery was fast. I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Curley

customer_reviews.title: NOT ALL HERE<<<
customer_reviews.text: majorly disappointed.. the box in a box was busted open.. missing all of one side. It has no bolts or anything to put it together. it missing so much stuff i dont even know if i can make it function. not only am i in a major family emergency and need this .. i cant even use it cause it dont have all the parts. DO NOT ORDER THIS<<<<< now i have to find bolts and nuts and all the right sizes and correct threads.. i aint got time for this crap.. VERY DISAPPOINTED IN AMAZON<<< how could your people toss this open not all there order into a box and ship it to me? WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tham's World

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad it broke in assembly instead of while my bike ...
customer_reviews.text: The hardware for this item is as cheap as it gets. The bolt that holds the angle iron piece to the chalk broke with very little tightening. What a POS. The bolt was a hex hollow void inside. I'm glad it broke in assembly instead of while my bike was on it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Westfall

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this product so far
customer_reviews.text: I do like this stand. It has worked well with some small modification. I welded on a longer angle iron (3ft) to lengthen the short crossbar so i can use it stand alone in the driveway/garage. I also welded on two eyelets to hook ratchet straps from crossbar to handle bars to secure my bike while i worked on it. Is good and sturdy and i would recommend this to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Burnes

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for sportbikes!
customer_reviews.text: Look elsewhere if you own a sportbike. I bought this for my ducati panigale. Because the wheel chock is too wide for the 17inch wheels, it would not hold my bike upright. Without using a rear stand the bike would surely fall on its side.
customer_reviews.author: Sherwin S.

customer_reviews.title: Little Disappointed - Wobbly...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to chock a KTM 1290 on a flatbed trailer for 2000 mile RT. Hoped it would allow me to easily place and tie down the bike by myself with the chock holding the bike up instead of using the kickstand. Did not help at all. The pivot could not be adjusted in any position that would fit the tire and create a "locking" position. Actually made the bike more unstable when in the chock. Finally removed the pivot completely and used it as a simple chock. As a standard chock - it was just fine. Heavily enough constructed to secure the bike when properly tied down with straps.
customer_reviews.author: K. Creole

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs additional options
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, although there needs to be a additional position for larger tires, I have a 19 front. And with a couple of additional positions this would be allowed so the wheel locking pivot accepts this . Also they could make a adjustment in front that would give more options to width of tires so they may sit secured in cradle. I will make these adjustments on my own.
customer_reviews.author: christopher cummings

customer_reviews.title: Very wide chock but worked great
customer_reviews.text: At first I wasn’t sure if I liked it. The space for the wheel is so wide I thought it would never hold bike up. You definitely cannot use without strapping bike down. I used this wheel chock for my 2020 FXST from Florida to Oregon in my truck bed and it worked perfectly. No issues for 2700 miles. I just mounted chock to two 2x4’s so it wouldn’t slide around. The straps came in handy. Very heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: mateo bachini

customer_reviews.title: Buy this! Don't wastey money on any other wheel chock!
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I get this much quality for under $100.00!!! This was super sturdy even before screwing it down to the trailer it held my bike (2015 GSX-R750) upright without any worry of it going anywhere. I did have to go down to the hole closest to the front to get my tire to fit. It doesn't "lock" into place so you can still rock the bike off the stand but it does hold your bike up securely once in the chock.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Held my Motorcycle in my Pickup Truck like the Rock of Gibraltar!
customer_reviews.text: I cut some 2" x 2" x 1/8th" Aluminum Stock from my local Ace Hardware Store and used some Bolts/Nuts/Washers to mount this Wheel Chock to the Bed of my 2nd Gen Honda Ridgeline Pickup. Using Six Ty-Down Straps (3 on each side), my 570 Lbs Motorcycle rode safely and securely thanks to this Stout Wheel Chock. My front tire size is 120/70ZR-17 and I used the rearmost holes to mount the "See-Saw" Pivot.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Product is sturdy, well made
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to haul my 2000 Valkyrie Tourer in a Utility Trailer. Product is sturdy, well made, no interference from fender or brake calibers.. I have made many trips and this product performed as expected. My Valkyrie is a large heavy bike weighing around 800 Lbs and it does fill up this wheel chock. I have the front wheel adjustment at its widest so as to fit. Product works great..
customer_reviews.author: Donald Blad

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy if you need it to hold the bike up with out additional support
customer_reviews.text: The chock only works if the bike is 90deg to the ground. It does not have enough support to keep it from tipping over if its even slightly off center. In this case it was leaning to the right 2 or 3 deg because my lift is not total level until it lifts up a little. In the time it took me to walk the other side and grab wheel stand it went over. Lesson learned when it comes to stands spend the money and get real stuff
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Needs a fat front tire to be effective.
customer_reviews.text: This like most trailer wheel chocks are designed with only fat tire bikes like harleys in mind. The tall skinny front tire on my bmw GSA has tons of slop in the front hoop and it doesnt hold the bike up at all..however it will provide alot of security paired with regular strapping. I wish they would make a more narrow version for all the other bikes out there. Great quality though and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.author: DEAN

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: I ride a Harley Street Glide ‘18, I made sure to adjust the back wheel lock so it doesn’t hit my front fender. The only issue is once it’s in place there’s still a lot of room for the bike to lean or possibly fall over. The box came destroyed and parts were chipped so I’m assuming it was a return but all the pieces were there and I bought it last minute for a trip so I kept it. Wouldn’t recommend, I would just buy the bike stand at harbor freight
customer_reviews.author: Bradley neary

customer_reviews.title: Great design, but...
customer_reviews.text: It's very solid/strong, despite being easy to assemble. I really like the overall concept and design, but... The reason I'm only giving it 3.5 stars is that it's too small. While it will accommodate a 7+" wide tire, it is too small for the diameter wheel of every bike I have. I had to move the bike as far forward as possible, then use a tie-down to strap the wheel to the front bar in order to keep it from immediately rolling back. That's definitely not what I was looking for in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Koelling

customer_reviews.title: Used it once so far, seems legit.
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly certain this product kept my bike from going down when utilizing an inferior strap product to keep the bike stable in my enclosed trailer. Be careful not to damage your fender, check for clearance as you're pulling the bike onto this product. My 2015 Street Glide utilizes the second set of holes from the back the best, I believe the first set of holes would've caused damage to the fender if I weren't paying attention.
customer_reviews.author: ltmonson

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design.  Not Safe.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty product, and it "works", but will not hold motorcycles vertical, as intended, for 90 - 110 mm front tire sizes (sport bike or cruiser). Motorcycle has excessive lean when using product. Definitely needs at least two tie-downs for either transporting bike or bike maintenance. Issue: front tire support is too wide and not adjustable. Price is low (I bought 2 for my 2 motorcycles), but I won't be using them. Consumer assumes all risk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit
customer_reviews.text: Well made, heavy duty. Weights about 22 pounds. I think it will keep my Yamaha WR450 from moving forward or back but I will strap it to the chock anyway. It will not prevent a dirt bike with it's skinny tire from tipping over so you must strap the bike to the walls or floor of a trailer. It will keep the front wheel from sliding sideways which can loosen the straps.
customer_reviews.author: gun hugger

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Absolute junk! The plate metal, strong (but how can you get that wrong), mounting hardware is absolute crap. Broke two bolt heads off just using a 17mm and 16mm closed end wrench. Made me feel like a brute gorilla at first, then just realized it was crappy material. I have a 21” wheel on my 790 Adventure. Won’t hold the wheel secure in any position. Absolutely worthless. Now the kicker, the wife threw the box out this morning and garbage already collected! Ugh
customer_reviews.author: Smokinguitars

customer_reviews.title: Works OK for vStar 950
customer_reviews.text: Works OK for my vStar 950. Like others have said, this is for a very wide tire. If you're looking to stay perfectly vertical, this may not work great. If you're ok with up to 15 degrees other side, that's fine. Basically, this lifts up the front just enough, and keeps it straight up just enough, I can fit an oil pan collector under the bike, and works well for storing in the garage. Otherwise, this thing is solid as heck and quite heavy. Seems well built. Happy for what I wanted it for.
customer_reviews.author: N. Butler

customer_reviews.title: Get new hardware. Other than that, good chock
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty sturdy and secures the bike. I wouldn't do too much work without the bike strapped down. Came missing one nut. All the hardware is garbage anyway, threads were messed up on most of the bolts and nuts. Save your time and run to Lowe's and pick up some 3/8x1" bolts and lock nuts before it gets delivered. Like a previous review, worked on a 17 HD Ultra with the pivot plate on the second from back hole.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Purchased one and the quality was great. It held my bike great with the front ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one and the quality was great. It held my bike great with the front tire about 1 /2 inch from the floor. Fender was close but OK. Only big problem is getting my Harley Road king out of it. I had to pull so hard and yank so many times I pulled a muscle in my neck. I am 5' 8" and 165. Maybe a bigger guy could, but I left the choke off and used as a stopper in my trailer for when I strap it in.
customer_reviews.author: gary bussjaeger

customer_reviews.title: Great option for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well! For the price you just cant beat it. It is sturdy and easy to install onto a trailer. The only gripe I have is that my 18 zx10rr front wheel doesnt quite fit properly on the cradle. If the cradle could be moved back a notch or two more it would be perfect. The bike will stay upright in the chock but if you bump the bike or dont have it straight it can tip over.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Busch

customer_reviews.title: Cruiser Owners Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this wheel chock because it will fit my 180 front tire. BEWARE of the locking mechanism hitting the fender as it sets in place. A previous review was very helpful in saving my fender. I tried a few different positions, but could not get my front wheel to work. It does work on my other two bikes so I'll keep it and just remove the lock for my HD.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Dame

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with KLR650
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chock to transport my KLR650. Unfortunately, I was unable to test it before my return date expired. The product description says “Designed to hold 17" - 21" wheels between 3-5/32" - 7-3/32" wide”. My front tire is 21” x 3.5” and the bike is completely un-stable in the chock. There is no way I can leave the bike alone in the chock even for a moment while I try to tie it down. A complete waste of my time and money. The description should read “only works on hogs”.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Indian roadmaster.
customer_reviews.text: 2017 and 2015 Indian roadmaster with the full front fender......the chock has issues. The back part hits the fender in every position. Not a big problem if you have a grinder. I had to shorten the back side of it and it works great. Now......getting the bike out of the chock was impossible with my wife doing it by herself. I had to help push it out. When I tried to back it out it was difficult for me too. But it is sturdy. And well built. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Drag/ gangster fenders may not work with this chock. Be aware.
customer_reviews.text: Just put it together. Work just as described. Only thing is I have baron gangster fenders on my bike. So the part you drive over hits my fender. But that’s on me. The wheel chock It self works great. I might have to mod my fender or the bracket on the chock.... but I’m keeping it. It’s just not made for a low fender bike.
customer_reviews.author: Bee man

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Make sure that you adjust the rear rotating portion tofu you from wheel otherwise if you have a low-hanging fender as you might with a Harley, it might damage it Very study. I bolted it down on a medium sized garden trailer with wood decking. The chock coupled with tie down straps is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Just buy the stand. The included straps are junk.
customer_reviews.text: The stand looks nice and we'll built good paint job not weld bbs all over it. Everything fits together as it should only used it once so far. The starps on the other hand leave functionality to be desired and my that I mean that don't ratchet at all. Sure they look nice but they don't work.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Tisdale

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come complete, be prepared to purchase mounting hardware.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these, which are now mounted onto a trailer. Ive had a 09 fatbob, 06 Springer softail, and dirtbikes on it with no issues. My issue us as follows. Both of the kits I purchased came incomplete, and only contained 5 nuts and 5 bolts. Each of the chocks requires 10 bolts and 12 nuts to be fully assembled and installed. I had to purchase the remaining assembly hardware separately. Other then the hardware issue it's a decent product. Since it was sent incomplete its recieving a one star review from me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael O'Donnell

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and works
customer_reviews.text: Very nice wheel chock compared to the ultratow ones. I wish I would have bought another one of these instead of the 2 ultra tow ones. Mounted on my trailer, makes towing and securing a motorcycle easy. Have used it on the floor but with a centerstand its really no reason for it besides trailering.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Harley guys be cautious
customer_reviews.text: I really thought I'd like this but be cautious if you ride a bike with a low front fender. This hit the lower fender Harley Ultra classic. Once I finish working on the bike I'll try to make adjustments to the clamp location to see if this fixed the problem.
customer_reviews.author: mnmn926

customer_reviews.title: Going to my sons.
customer_reviews.text: This product work very well on my trailer I have a garden trailer that I used to tow my bike 6 hours to my son's house so that we could go riding. They held the bike in place kept it safe the whole trip. I would recommended. Putting it on the trailer was pretty easy adjusting it and making it fit my bike was just as easy.
customer_reviews.author: freedom6227

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for use for dirt bikes with minimal tire size.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit to hold my 250 Yamaha dirt bike. Said it would fit a tire of just over 3 inches because of the V-Groove. While it does do a pretty good job of holding the tire from going backwards or forewords, it does almost nothing from keeping it from falling over in either direction. It does not work well for a smaller dirt bike tire.
customer_reviews.author: j. caho

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Well-built and heavy-duty. Fit my H-D Superglide with 100/90-19 tire perfectly.Great customer service. Unit was missing one bolt, no big deal but emailed seller, and they sent me two. Would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Woked great on my 2016 Suzuki
customer_reviews.text: I needed to trailer my 2016 Suzuki Boulevard 800. Mounted this chock on a piece of plywood because I didn't want to drill holes in my metal trailer. The front wheel and fender mounted with no problems and no damage to wheel, fender etc. Absolutely no problems on 1,700 trip.
customer_reviews.author: SV5

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought one to hold the motorcycle inside of my van... It works very well, the wheel goes in easy and then it locks it in place with a firm hold. Couple straps on sides and you are ready to go. Year later I bought another one and I haven't even looked at any other brand. You will be happy with this product and it's quality.
customer_reviews.author: Kitchen Craft LLC

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for my 2012 Yamaha Stryker 1300
customer_reviews.text: I used this chock with a handlebar strap and some rachet tiedowns to move my 2012 Yamaha Stryker 1300cc on a u-haul 5x9 trailer for an 8 hour drive. I used the widest setting for the front wheel and it fit fine. No damage to the bike and it stayed put in the chocks. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jim O

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, great buy
customer_reviews.text: We're 5k miles into pulling two bikes in a cargo trailer behind our RV and the chocks have been fantastic. I use 2 straps per bike and they're held firmly in place and ride well. I had to reset the nyloc nuts on the pivot bolts one time and have been great since (the side that tries to undo with articulation as they're not LH threads). Well built, sturdy pieces and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Harvey

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, well made, does the job. My only gripe- BE CAREFUL IF YOU HAVE A LOW/LONG FRONT FENDER!!!!! My stock roadglide front fender was slightly damaged while putting my bike onto this chock. Fender got wedged by the wheel chock's rear portion that is meant to hold the back side of the front tire when rolled into position. Buyer beware and be cautious when using for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: T.M

customer_reviews.title: SUPER GOOD STUFF!
customer_reviews.text: 650 lb motorcycle ..... Ride the bike up the trailer and this thing 'captures' the front tire / wheel and tie it down for a worry free super dependable support. This item sells for THREE times this amount anywhere else and is better than most of those!
customer_reviews.author: Marc Pottle

customer_reviews.title: These Chocks are awesome, and the included Straps are way better than ...
customer_reviews.text: These Chocks are awesome, and the included Straps are way better than even my best ratchet straps. I love that there is not an extra 10-14' of strap left over after securing my bike, and I love the strap wrap around the handle bars which eliminates the bar straps and another step in securing the bike. Much much faster and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: worked geat
customer_reviews.text: It worked prefect as I expected, it's not going to hold a big heavy bagger upright very well but good enough that you can harness it down by yourself. Which is what I expected. I doubt any wheel chock on the market will be any better
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Great quality great price
customer_reviews.text: Good quality works great on my Harley Sportster although my wheel is smaller that 17 inches it’s actually 16 my tires are mega fat so perfect fit. The only thing was no tie down brackets attached to the steelwork. Easily solved but the addition would make it perfect
customer_reviews.author: Phdinnis

customer_reviews.title: I should have saved & bought a condor.
customer_reviews.text: You can not leave your bike without tie downs. I have a 2008 fat boy and even my front tire is to narrow. You can adjust for the circumference of the tire but not the width. Once you dock the bike it will eventually lean and fall to the side.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Rhoda

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: With the stand mounted and some anchors for the straps your bike will not budge. Very happy with this stand. I used an anchor on each side about a foot out on each side and it works great from hauling my ducati monster 821.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Not safe to use
customer_reviews.text: So looks awesome. Works terrible. Holder is way too wide and does not fit Sportbike front tires as it says it can. My bike will totally fall over if left alone. Not safe at all to work on my bike as described. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: neil mendel

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty to the max
customer_reviews.text: Excellent in every way, I am very pleased with the wheel chock. Bought this to trailer a 2008 Honda cbr1000rr, very confident knowing the bike is secured to the trailer. Highly recommend this one for sure Thanks max
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: good value/product
customer_reviews.text: put two in the trailer. Worked great for Harley. BMW narrow front tire was not as stable but still worked until straps could be tightened. Once strapped down neither moved again until we released them. Can't see how the more expensive ones could be better or do more.
customer_reviews.author: GRO

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well built
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use, its on my table lift. roll on lock in that simple. I put straps on the back of the bike when I begin to lift it up for my own safety reasons I don't want the back of the bike moving while I'm wrenching
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Easy for solo use.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my 2009 Vulcan 900. I mounted it to a wood deck utility trailer along with Kayak racks. Now i can drive the whole family in one vehicle pulling the trailer with 4 kayaks and a motorcycle as a shuttle vehicle. The wheel chalk hold my heavy bike upright while i strap it down myself. I’ve used it now almost weekly for 4 months during the last summer season.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Idahoan

customer_reviews.title: If you haul a large bike you need this
customer_reviews.text: 1998 Goldwing worked perfectly in this. I hauled the bike almost 200 miles to trade it on a BMW R1250RT. The RT worked but is a bit smaller so it didn’t fit as tight but this still was a help.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Does a fantastic job holding your bike, as long as you can hold IT in place
customer_reviews.text: STURDY. Holy crap, this thing is heavy. They did not mess about when they built this. It would hold a airplane wheel. Four optional pivot points for the rear cradle, coarse thread nuts and lock bolts. Only downside is it's unstable unless bolted to the bed, and no openings for hooks, will drill some myself. Horizontal bar has hole flush with ground, but a second bar on the opposite side would make a much sturdier mount. Still and all, does a fantastic job holding your bike, as long as you can hold IT in place.
customer_reviews.author: Reerr

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Holds my Harley in my toy hauler. Nice piece of equipment to keep bike upright and keeps front wheel locked. Easier to strap when bike is straight standing keeps weight on wheels not kickstand.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Brevard

customer_reviews.title: Works well good fit and finish
customer_reviews.text: If you have the money buy a condor Motorcycle stand I use the extreme Max to go to Sturgis this last August 2019 It held the motorcycle in place the whole way no issues A bit hard to get The motorcycle out of the stand By yourself I ran into a friend he recommended the condor
customer_reviews.author: Amy Y

customer_reviews.title: Great Stone products for full tour bike
customer_reviews.text: Melted easily, design for full size tour bike, very sturdy and adjustable for the wheel size. This one came with a pair of tie down straps which had the integrated soft and strap to wrap around the bike frame.
customer_reviews.author: Brent R. Doney

customer_reviews.title: Not a wide enough base
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this you will need to bolt it to the floor and add in a few extra places to secure your bike. on it's own this will not hold up a HD, not even a sportster
customer_reviews.author: Carlo P.

customer_reviews.title: Would not support the bike.
customer_reviews.text: I went to the trouble to install anchors in my garage floor to bolt this down for safety and stability. However, the unit would not hold the bike and keep it from falling over. Would not recommend nor trust this item to hold anything of value. I actually returned it. I was very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: D. A. Blake

customer_reviews.title: and it does that wonderfully.
customer_reviews.text: For long road trips with your bike in the bed or on a trailer, this is a must. You can get away without it in the bed of a truck, but not for verry long. I just used ratchet strapes to keep this centered while transporting the bike, that way I didn't have to drill out my bed. It's only purpose is just to keep the bike from sliding out from underneeth itself, and it does that wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Tson

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: All I have to say is PERFECT!!! Durable, sturdy, easy install with drill, and designed well. Best wheel chock you'll find for the price. My lift is now complete and no worries of the bike to fall over.
customer_reviews.author: The Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Very well built. Bought these for my new motorcycle ...
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. Bought these for my new motorcycle trailer and was rear ended the following month. The trailer was totaled, my Cadillac Escalade was totaled, and the Yamaha I was towing was totaled, but I was able to pull the wheel chocks off and will be reusing them. I mounted them with flat steel on the other side of the wood trailer to add strength and will be doing that again. I don't think you can beat these for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Viffer

customer_reviews.title: 2012 CVO Road Glide decent but not stabile enough to trust
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, nice paint or powder coating, sturdy even without being bolted down but the base is too slippery to get out without being bolted down. Once it was bolted down I gave it a shake, it wasn’t bad but Im probably going to return it and spend the money on a condor because it could definitely fall down if you gave it a shake and I can’t take that chance. If you’re on a budget or maybe ride a jap bike then go for it. $60,000 Harleys? No thanks
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Poor Packaging and Delivery
customer_reviews.text: Good motorcycle stand but same one as harbor freight’s. $10 more than harbor freight but with prime i didnt have to leave the house. Good product, a little upset packaging was broke and the top support got scuffed and mared. Between its lack of padding in package and Amazons delivery team of hulks the box tore and scratched it. Otherwise seems like a good product.
customer_reviews.author: logan wentzel

customer_reviews.title: Added security for transporting your motorcyles.
customer_reviews.text: I used this, along with Rino straps and a canyon dancer, to secure my GSX-R 1000 in order travel from the east coast to the west coast. I transported it in the bed of my pick-up, so It gave me the added security and stablity I was looking for. Also, made the tie down process easier for one person. Main reason I didn't give a 5 star review is because the instructions were purposely left vauge due to the companies perceived liability and I had to figure out myself the correct way to assemble it for my bike.
customer_reviews.author: CPP

customer_reviews.title: SAFELY CORRALS "THE BLUE BEAST"
customer_reviews.text: Kudos for 1) heavy duty materials and construction, 2) ease of assembly, 3) quality of hardware, 4) securely holds The Beast (a beastly heavy 2004 Honda ST1300A). Great job, Extreme Max!
customer_reviews.author: FloridaFellow

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I trusted this product to hold my harley road glide special as I moved several states. Because it doesn't come with a strap over the front tire to hold the wheel down into the rack, the bike turned over not just once or twice, but several times before I had to just leave it. I will NEVER mention this product to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Yroc

customer_reviews.title: Support cross bracket substandard. Dissapointed.....
customer_reviews.text: Paid extra because it showed an angle iron bar to screw down or strap to. The U tray is study and well made. The nose bracket is thick and sturdy. The cradle is thick metal. But the the angle iron bracket is 1/8" 1.5x1.5 .... As soon as you attach a strap to it, it flexes.....and could easily bend. Would not trust to hold my motorbike upright or on a trip. Would return if I did not drill 2 holes to bolt to my trailer. Bill
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good hold
customer_reviews.text: Does not hold my Vstar 650 Classic in a solid upright position. Bike will lean left or right will not stay completely upright. Unless I am soing something wrong.....then it stays at a 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Super Impressive
customer_reviews.text: We used these to trailer two bikes. Very sturdy and not too difficult to install. Super sturdy, and great value for the price! I definitely recommend these!!!
customer_reviews.author: Iowa Girl

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Put together in minutes. Solid construction and does the trick to keep my front wheel upright while wrenching in the garage. Great product and glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: A must have for my vintage bike.
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my toy hauler garage to support my V65 Magna long enough for me to dismount and secure with straps. Thats all I ask for. Good price, will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: John J

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This stand is beyond my expectations. It will work for any street bike you have. I mean any! From a 250 all the way to boss hoss. It's built very well. Does not come with hardware to attach to a trailer. It is very easy to assemble. 5 stars without a doubt!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I bought this. Moving my 2009 Hayabisa was a sinch. I put it on a utility trailer and Bam , perfect. Very easy to use and super sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great little chock - heavy but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great little product. It is HEAVY; heavier that most others I've had. Very sturdy, easy to set up and does the job well. Used it twice so far to haul my bike to the track on the back of a pick up truck. Just make sure you are setting up the chock correctly to the right size of your tire or you could damage the undercarriage on your bike. I have a Panigale 1199 and use at 3rd hole.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian River

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Just put wheel chock together I'm going to tell you what this is very solid I'm a smaller guy I had to get help pulling out of the stand which is just fine the bike and stand are going in the back of a moving truck, with 4 heavy duty straps done.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Adcock

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle Wheel Chock
customer_reviews.text: Good price, heavy duty. Does not fit my 120/70-17" wheel quite snug enough. Extended the front ears with angle iron and added tie down eye hooks so front of motorcycle could be better secured in the chock.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Work well for my 2013 Harley Roadking CVO
customer_reviews.text: Worked well in enclosed trailer & seems like they're built heavy duty! I moved cradle pivot bolt to 2nd hole from rear with 130/60B-19 tires. Also made a 1-5/8 inch diameter washer/plug x 3/4 inch thick with 3/8-16 threads/bolt to lock pivot cradle in rearward hole as an extra measure when transporting my bike. The supplied bolts could of been a tad bit longer, barely engaged the nylon locknuts.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great product but arrived with deep scratches
customer_reviews.text: These are nice wheel chocks. Very heavy duty construction. They support my Harley Road King very securely. They deserve five stars for product quality. Unfortunately, they are poorly packaged. I bought two of them, and they both arrived with scratches through to bare metal on both wheel cradles and both bases. I had to touch up the paint before installation to prevent rust. Just a bit of extra cardboard to separate the parts from each other in shipping could protect them better.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Visser

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: works well when on a 400 mile trip and it held my bike in place its just a little wide for my 20 in skinny custom tire but it works
customer_reviews.author: 3-D

customer_reviews.title: Everything it should be
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and installed this on my trailer to haul my 1199 Ducati. Only had to purchase 4 bolts to mount it. Bike sits very secure when in the chock. Well built and seems like it will last awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the value
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the value. Just be careful when mounting full dresser motorcycles and this can make contact with the lower portion of your cruiser. My Roadking has to be re adjusted to properly make clearance. After that we transported effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: P.J.

customer_reviews.title: Beefier than it looks
customer_reviews.text: Wow, is this thing beefy. From looking at the pictures I never imagined it would be so sturdy. It holds up my 850 pound Harley without any straps on it. Of course I'm going to use tie down straps, but I like that I can park the bike in the wheel chock, and then get off the bike to tie it down without worrying that it might fall over.
customer_reviews.author: hookjockey

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2, one on my trailer and one in my toy hauler camper. Secured my very heavy, 1800 cc bike very well.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Myers

customer_reviews.title: the wheel toggle is bad
customer_reviews.text: The wheel toggle is a good Idea, but it came up and smashed the back of the fender. There goes the custom paint job!
customer_reviews.author: Ron Dupuis

customer_reviews.title: Work very well
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and very easy to setup. Used T-nuts so it can be easily removed if needed. Worked for our 2008 Gold Wing. Very satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: kenblk

customer_reviews.title: Really knot for wide front tires
customer_reviews.text: I tried to bend them for my Indian NO GOOD. I threw them out, idisp8x9 maybe for dirt bikes but not road bikes that O have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built
customer_reviews.text: Well built and easy to assemble. This is the same one you find at some of the hardware stores for about 10$ less.
customer_reviews.author: j

product_meta.title: Extreme Max 5001.5010 Standard Motorcycle Wheel Chock - Black
product_meta.description: Style:StandardThe Extreme Max Motorcycle Wheel Chock is sleek, stable, and solid. Drive your bike onto the chock and the rear wheel cradle locks the front wheel securely in place. One person can safely and easily secure the motorcycle without tipping. Made of durable steel and finished with a textured matte black powder coat, this wheel chock will look great in shop or trailer. The chock is designed to take up minimal room on the mounting surface while providing maximum stability for your bike. By combining a solid front cross bar with a solid boot, this chock uses floor space more efficiently than any other design. This space-saving design is great for storing or hauling multiple bikes or for mounting on a lift. Multiple rear wheel cradle adjustments allow you to fit wheels perfectly for stability during storage, transport, or maintenance. Fits 17 inch - 21 inch wheels between 3-5/32 inch - 7-3/32 inch wide. Note: Motorcycles with front wheel fender skirts and/or front wheel fender extensions should not use the wheel chock with the pivoting cradle set in the fourth hole (longest position). Use caution during the initial setup to ensure proper clearance on all bodywork.
feature_bullets: Solid front cross bar and boot provide maximum stability
Durable steel and textured semi-gloss black powdercoat provide heavy duty strength and good looks
Multiple rear wheel cradle adjustments fit wheels perfectly
Designed to hold 17" - 21" wheels between 3-5/32" - 7-3/32" wide

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,155 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
